abstract.para: Total Chlorophyll a for lake ne9b at Toolik lake research site during the summer of 1993.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

description.para:
Log of changes:
A new Turner 450 Fluorometer was used during the summer of 1992 in place of the old Turner 111 Fluorometer used in previous years.

For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: 1-27-95 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Neil Bettez DATE: 1-27-95

para.literalLayout: Water samples were collected weekly at 0,1,3,5,8,12,16 meter depths in the lakes. The water was returned to the lab where it was filtered through a 47 mm Whatman GF/C glass fiber filter. The filters were then placed in 10 ml of 90% acetone and extracted in the dark for 24 hours. The samples were then read on a Turner 450 Fluorometer with a left side emission window of 10x and a right side activation window of 30x.
Notes: The flurometer was calibrated using a standard curve made using chlorophyll a from Anacystis nidulans purchased from Sigma and quantified using a spectrophotometer.
Reference Citations: R.G. Wetzel & G.E. Likens. 1979. Limnological Methods. Saunders. Philadelphia.

Variable Variable descrip. Precis./Units Coded Missing (Y/N) Values Site site code y n Lake Site of measurement n n DEPTH Depth meters n n DATE Date DD-MMM-YY n n chlor a Total Chloroph ug/L n n (12) CALCULATIONS Variable Formula total 1x reading = avg reading/(left side emission window*gain) total chlor a (ug/l) = 9.3962*(total 1x reading)+.0454 total chlor a ug/L in sample = (total chlor a)*(ml acetone/1000)/(ml filtered/1000)
